H85.def: = man, also known as {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H4135.def: = action by which someone removes the foreskin of the penis, + preferably with a {L:flint<SDBH:צֹר>} knife, as a sign of the covenant between YHWH and Abraham's descendants; ≈ considered an outward change for the good that should be accompanied by an inward change in attitude as well

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3211.def: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate

H4736.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5236.def: = state in which something is associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own

H4135.def: = action by which someone removes the foreskin of the penis, + preferably with a {L:flint<SDBH:צֹר>} knife, as a sign of the covenant between YHWH and Abraham's descendants; ≈ considered an outward change for the good that should be accompanied by an inward change in attitude as well
